org.usfirst.frc.team3926.robot.subsystems

Class DriveControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
      • org.usfirst.frc.team3926.robot.subsystems.DriveControl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.NamedSendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Sendable

    public class DriveControl
extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
    Enables driving of the robot with a tank drive scheme. This class contains anything relevant to actuating the drive motors. This includes autonomous handling of the robot.

        Resets the data for the drive system

      • driveTank

        public void driveTank(double rightSpeed,
                      double leftSpeed,
                      boolean straight,
                      boolean safe)
        Drives the robot in a tank configuration
        Parameters:
        rightSpeed - Speed to set the right motor
        leftSpeed - Speed to set the left motor
        straight - Whether or not the robot should drive straight
        safe - Whether or not to reduce robot speed

      • driveTank

        public void driveTank(double rightSpeed,
                      double leftSpeed)
        Drives the robot in tank configuration
        Parameters:
        rightSpeed - Speed to set the right side of the drive train
        leftSpeed - Speed to set the left side of the drive train

      • autonomousTank

        public void autonomousTank(boolean targetGears)
        Drives the robot towards a target autonomously
        Parameters:
        targetGears - Set this to true if vision tracking should work to center itself on gears not the high goal target, which it will do if this is true

      • center

        public void center(boolean targetGears)
        Centers the robot on a target based on vision tracking data

        To actually get data this calls autonomousTank(boolean) and than inverts the speed on the opposite of the side to move to, this causes the robot to turn.

        Parameters:
        targetGears - Whether or not this is being run to focus on the gear targets

      • continueDriving

        public void continueDriving()
        Keeps the robot driving based on it's current left and right side speed values

      • withinDistance

        public boolean withinDistance(double desiredDistance)
        Checks if the robot is at or closer than desiredDistance
        Parameters:
        desiredDistance - Distance to check if the robot is closer to an object than
        Returns:
        If the rangefinder's measured distance is less than or equal to the desired distance

      • rightEncoderCheck

        public boolean rightEncoderCheck(double rightEncoderValue)
        Checks if the robot has traveled past a value on the right side
        Parameters:
        rightEncoderValue - Value to check if the right encoder has passed
        Returns:
        If the right encoder on the drive train has traveled past the given distance

      • leftEncoderCheck

        public boolean leftEncoderCheck(double leftEncoderValue)
        Checks if the robot has traveled past a value on the left side
        Parameters:
        leftEncoderValue - Value to check if the left encoder has passed
        Returns:
        If the left encoder's distance value if past the given distance

        Parameters:

      • straightDrive

        private void straightDrive()
        Drive the robot straight (based on the speed of the right side)

        This is activated by pressing OI.straightMode

      • safeMode

        private void safeMode()
        Drive the robot in safety mode (reduces the speed by RobotMap.DRIVE_SAFETY_FACTOR

        This is activated by pressing OI.safetyMode
